Today marks one month since my girlfriend passed away due to cancer, only 32 years. Due to medical negligence, we were unaware that her breast cancer had evolved into a brain metastasis, and we only found out when she started experiencing headaches and was intubated. Unfortunately, it was too late for treatment, and she suffered brain death. The pain is immense; I think about her every day when I wake up and when I go to bed, that is, when I can sleep. She also left behind a 6-year-old son. I love Imagine Dragons, and whenever they come to Brazil, I attend their shows. When Dan Reynolds talks about taking care of those we love, from now on, I will always remember her with much love and affection.

This song is so powerful!  All their music is!!!  I love how deep, full and hardy so much of it can be.  On one hand, someone with no current problems or struggles... can listen to it and jam out all day long. Then on the other hand, someone who is really going through it hard... can get every bit as into it but in a much different way. Allowing us an outlet, a vent for everything that has built up inside and needs to get out.  It's absolutely heartbreakingly, and heart mendingly beautiful!  Sending big love to everyone dealing with loss, and hoping you can find the comfort you need to get through everything you maybe facing. A bit late posting to this, but it came up as YouTube was randomly playing things for me. I've listened to it multiple times be it on here, the radio, or spotify. I just wanted to take a moment to write out how it has affected and helped me during a very difficult process. When I first heard it, 2 years ago, my grandfather had just passed away. The man, for all intent and purpose, that was my father figure for majority of my life. Every time I hear this song, like now, I can't help but take a moment to remember him. To grieve him. I allow myself a few minutes to do that while listening to this song whenever it comes up. Grieving is never over.  Thank you ID. Thank you for writing, creating, producing, and pushing a song like this out into the world.

I've lost so many loved ones who were key to my life, one by one until it felt so much emptier, losing those who knew and loved me best and who I loved best from my childhood. Both parents, a brother, my aunts. But the one that hit the hardest and messed me up the most was my first grand daughter at 4yrs old. I just layed in bed most of a few years, so broken. I lost all these people within a few years. So brutal.  One day I was driving down the road and I had a memory, a strong memory like I was there, reliving it. In this memory my family was gathered in a beautiful meadow, my granddaughter was there, and we were all gathered at her gravestone. Heaven was having a blow out celebration because she had been promoted or graduated to something that was a big deal for her and that she worked really hard and long to achieve, and we were all there to celebrate with her, it was like a ceremony and then she would be in the new place doing some kind of amazing job she'd always wanted in a next level. We were all happy for her.  It was like this was where my consciousness went. When I came back to this reality, it was like that was real and this life didn't happen, then I slowly started to remember how it happened here and that it was utterly devastating for my daughter, her husband and other grand daughters, and myself. But it was the beginning of a slow trickle of healing. A healing I didn't think would ever come. And may not have without that vision/ memory.

The first time I heard this song, i had my headphones on, listening to music, while i cleaned my house. I started sobbing!! My big brother and i were best friends. We were 3.5 years apart. We had gotten into a huge fight the week before because i started dating someone he knew was not a good guy and forbid me to see him. It was a really bad fight. That weekend, my mom found us a place to move to. Prior to this we were all staying with different friends because we had been displaced. My brother and his friends helped us move into the house on Saturday. My brother took me aside, hugged me and told me he loved me, i did tell him that i loved him too. We had never done this after any other fight we had. This was before cell phones and we hadn't gotten the phone turned on yet. My brother asked if he could stay with his friends that night. My mom agreed and told them all that we would be by to take them all out to dinner for helping us a d then my brother was going to move in. He was moving in to help my mom with rent and help me get through some traumatic things i had already gone through. My mom and i got to my brothers friends house and there was a note on the door to meet them at the hospital. My brother and his friends fiance had gone to the grocery store a block and a half away earlier in the evening. On the way home, while making a left onto their street, the little Triumph car my brothers fiance was driving was hit by a motor home. My brother was killed on impact and his friends fiance died the next day. My brother died 5/15/88, 36 years ago today, at the age of 18. He always said he was going to take care of my mom, so, when he passed, that responsibility fell on me. My mom has always been a constant in my life. As she got older, she needed some help. She moved in with me 7.5 years ago. In October last year, my mom got diagnosed with terminal cancer. Shr said she was tired and wanted to be with my brother and i completely understood that because i have not gotten over losing him either. My mom passed away on 4/12/24, in our home, surrounded by everyone she loved. I cry because I'm in pain and i miss them but I'm so happy they are together again â¤

I lost my father on 6th October 2023 after a 2 year battle with advanced prostate cancer, this song is so powerful and reading through the comments on here, this song helps me to grieve as many of you say!  My Dad was 60 years of age who lost his battle to a horrendous disease, please men out there, don't hesitate to get your prostate checked when the time comes, be mindful of it in you're 40's and into your 50's. Women, please encourage your partners/husbands to go and get checked.  Here in the UK and around the world there needs to be much more awareness of the most common type of cancer in men. What a song I must say, me and my Dad listened to many songs by Imagine Dragons, all I can say to them is thank you very much.  Grief is such a strange thing, coming up to 6 months after my Dad's passing things are still quite raw, but some days I'll smile and then I'll cry it's hard to explain.  See you again one day Dad, take care I love you, rest in peace now you're no longer in any of that horrific pain.  Kieren

Possible interpretation: The song "Wrecked" seems to express deep sadness and longing after the loss of someone dear. The lyrical self reflects on the moments shared and the influence of the person who has passed away. The lyrics describe how the days pass, but the pain of loss persists. The lyrical self feels destroyed and wishes the loved one was back. There is a feeling of guilt and regret for not having enjoyed the moments together more. The song also mentions the words of encouragement that the deceased person used to give, reminding the lyrical self to move on, even if it is difficult. In short, "Wrecked" is an emotional song that deals with the pain of loss and the desire to keep the memory of the loved one alive. It expresses the feeling of emptiness and sadness that can accompany loss and the difficulty of moving on.

Lost my mom to cancer last year when I was 19, I'm still in college. This song really speaks to me because after she passed, it's like I became a different person. My grades started slipping, I started sleeping around and getting into alcohol and drugs. Things I never would have done before. I just wish I would have been able to talk to her one last time, because chemo really messed her head up in her last days. My flight back home was late and she passed while I was on the plane, every day I think about what I could have done differently to show her that I loved her because I never had the chance. When I heard this song in the car, I started bawling, the first time I've cried since she passed. It might sound cheesy, but I've been listening to Imagine Dragons religiously since I was in elementary school, and this is the one that really has inspired me to turn my behavior around, because I know what I'm doing isn't what she would have wanted. I miss you, mom. Thank you, Imagine dragons, for inspiring me my whole life.

My grandmother passed in 2012, and I never got to say good bye, or attend her funeral (because my dad was just that kind of spiteful at the time). My dog passed last year, and although it's not the same, she was still a major part of my life. I was with her until the end. Be it a beloved member of the family, a close friend, even someone you barely know... grief is not something everyone goes through the same way. The best anyone can do, is enjoy the time they have with the ones they're with. Every moment is precious. The fights, the make-ups, the laughs, all of it. Never forget them.

So it was my boyfriend's 61st birthday yesterday. He passed away 7 months ago so I celebrated it with friends. I played this song before we had a shot to him in memory. I didn't think it would effect them the way it did, but it brought tears to both of them. Neither of them have experienced this kind of a loss so I didn't think it would do anything. But it just goes to show what an awesome writer you are when you can replicate your feelings in someone else.  Truly these words say exactly how I feel now and I'm sure how I will feel 10 years from now. I will see you again Robert, my loved one.

What is the true story of this song?

As Reynolds previously revealed, â€œWreckedâ€ was inspired by the singerâ€™s late sister-in-law Alisha Durtschi Reynolds, who died following a cancer battle; a tribute to Alisha is shown at the  end of the Matt Eastin-directed video. â€œShe was the brightest light. A beacon of joy and strength for everyone she met. Her sudden passing has shaken me in ways that I still am unable to express,â€ Reynolds had said in a statement. â€œI was with her and my brother when she passed, and it was the first time in my life that I had witnessed death in this way. It sealed into my mind the fragility of life and finality of this all. Iâ€™ve watched my brother face something that no one should have to. But Iâ€™ve also seen his faith bring him hope in a future with her. I can only hope for the same.â€ Reynolds continued. â€œThis song was my way of dealing with it all, as music has always been my refuge. No longer being a man of fervent faith, I can only hope that she hears it somewhere in a place where she is healed and no longer in pain. This song is my wish for an eternity with those that I love.â€

I know the pain you're feeling,,,  and it's ok to be vulnerable and confused , not knowing what to do,   the reason I say this is because my first wife was raped and killed while I was at work,  ( post mortem rape).  My second wife was diagnosed with cervical cancer. Shortly after covid came around and they literally had to watch her fade away, she was losing weight at an incredible pace, and one morning on August the 13th which was a Friday in 2021 I woke up kissed a good morning and I asked her what she wanted to eat from the store and as soon as I left,,, she must have passed away minutes after I had stepped out of the door, because Returned about 10 minutes,  she pretty much choked in her own blood . And when I tried to perform CPR on her she was still somewhat warm... So I can definitely relate to your pain and how you feel,,,  and only thing I can tell you is you got to be strong,,,, you have to think of how she would want you to live your life,,, you can't give up,,,  unfortunately it is events like this that make a stronger and make us who we are today,,,,everyday I grieve for both of the women that I truly loved and lost,,, but I keep your memory alive in my heart,,, I know it's going to be hard but you have to hold your head up you have to be strong and time does heal all wounds,,,, if you ever need to let some steam off and talk,,,, you can always hit me up

She was my everything. I know to meet her again. I must live life and try to make her proud. I looked forward to meeting her again. She was and is my one and only true love forever. That guilt that you feel when you lose someone you truly love (and it's not just "blood family" that you're supposed to love)and you can't even cry because the pain goes so much deeper that that. People say you're hard, people say you don't care just because you don't show your pain. Not everyone understand that sometimes people CAN'T show their pain, because that's the way they're made, because they process grief in other ways, some self destructive, some self improving, but still they expect you to cry and be depressed all the time when in reality they don't know that maybe you can't sleep at night because you're remembering that particular moment with your loved one and you don't want to let it go, you don't want to sleep, you don't want to forget, you just want to be... back then. I'm sorry Dan and and all your family for your loss, I understand. I hope you understand that I understand. All my love.

I'm not mourning or grieving about a loved one, yet I still feel grief. And I just realized that I'm grieving for myself, that my life got destroyed and I will never be able to live the life I wanted. My life is not bad rn but I grief for the life I wanted to have. Wanted to join the army or police, now I'm thinking about getting my right leg voluntairily amputated. With 22 years.  I'm grieving for the joy that left my life, that got replaced by the clarity you have after you nearly died.  I find myself wrecked more often then I wish I'd do. I wanted to do something meaningful, being strong, sportive and just bursting from being alive. Now, I am only able to train my brain bc my body is aching, destroyed, chronicly ill. I will never feel the joy of bringing your body to it's limits again.  I'm grieving for the life I had.

I lost my mom 3 years ago. She died to cancer. We buried her on her birthday. I didn't cry until I was in the middle of class the next week. My emotions about it were on and off. I felt terrible, as if I wasn't crying or being emotional when I was supposed to. A year later I'm done with high school living on my own...and I break down...I was a complete wreck. Ever since then it never has gotten better. But I've realized that sucking it up isn't what needs to be done. When I need to cry, cry. When I need to scream, scream. But never forget and never regret. I miss her so much and it never lessens or gets better. And that's okay. It's okay to not be okay. She was such a big part in my life, and I never realized that until she was gone. If anyone here is going through this pain, please hear my words. You are going to be okay.  This person you've lost, they will always be watching over you. No matter how hard it gets please don't ever give up. We're in this together, you and me...all of us. So let's keep living together for the ones we've lost. Love you all.

This hit me today. It's been almost 2 years since I lost my brother. I see ppl that squander their lives and I hate them. It's eating me alive slowly. My sister in law showed up at my door. All I could say was  why the fuck are u here. I finally said fuck it and told her how I have felt for so long and told her I don't give a fuck what her excuses are. She always has an excuse, it's always someone else's fault, she's handed so many opportunities to get right and she squanders them. I told her she didn't deserve it, but my brother did. He was hard working, worked hard to get right after messing up cuz he had a lot of trauma from living a hard life. A shit start was handed him but he was strong and he fought his depression and fought to deal with his emotions, worked to make the life he wanted and our father took from us. And on his way to work he was tired we are assuming and he didn't see a truck in front of him with a trailer breaking. He realized it too late. I went to the scene and you could see the police spray and the gouges in the asphalt from his motorcycle being layed down. He tried but it was too late and he hit head-on into the end of the trailer. He was a good father raising his two daughters and stepson with his fiance. He'd finally found the love of his life. They had plans. He was happier than I had ever seen him. In an instant he was gone. And I hate others whom I feel fuck off their lives. I'd trade them from my brother anyday. He was better than hundreds of fuckoffs put together .

I can totally feel this song. My grandfather passed away during quarantine, in his own birthday. We had a complicated relationship, with some problems now I wont be able to fix, and I feel terrible about it. All those day I had him with me, I could use any of those to talk to him and say "I'm sorry about everything, I don't want to be angry with you, can we fix this please?" but I didn't, I could have a better relationship with him and I didn't. He was always by my side, he took care of me since I was a baby and he treated me like a queen, but now I can't even say thank you for everything.  So, everyone out there, please, if you have a problem with someone you love please try the best you can to fix it, because maybe one day they will just go away, and become nothing more than a memory

I just tried counting how many years it's been we last saw our friend, Ssgt Alex. Its been almost 20 years since a sniper hiding out in a car trunk took him from his family and loved ones. Military families know the heaviness of loss of life and the responsibility you have to make sure that everyone is ok. The loss of a friend, a mentor, a role model and someone that would take a bullet for you, I know that sounds aweful but I don't know how else to describe someone that would go out in front of you like that to make sure all was clear never feels any less. It doest go away or get better just bc it was a part of the job.  I've never met anyone else like him that would look out for you and your family. The lyrics to this song remind me of that kind of  love. "I'll see you again my loved one" In my mind, we are singing to him how much we appreciate the time we had with him and we can mourn the loss of the love that was felt on Sept 2nd, 2006 and  still to this day. this song was played at my dad's funeral.  He was only 52 years old and died of a brain tumor 6 months after finding out.  The past months before the diagnose we were in a big fight over stupid buisness stuff. (family buisness)  And i almost never visited him after the diagnose because i thought he would pull through and i was angry.  My grandfather died the year before because of lung cancer. but he lasted 20 years after the diagnose.  I thought it would be the same for my dad. God was i wrong.  Many regrets , all to late.  My mom and brother did all the caring, i did shit. Almost nothing. Just went on working as hard as i could.  I've never been so wrong.  I hope someone reads this and doesn't make the same mistakes as me. All this song makes me do is cry. and full with guilt.  Now, 6 months later. the buisness is going great. But it will never be the same. edit 2 years later (march 7 2025, you're birthday):  Buisness going better then ever.  I've met the woman of my dreams. We have a son together.  Last week i was just cruising around on my motorcycle and for a split second i thought , i will come to you're house and we can ride together. That would be cool. After that split second , i realised.  I'm so sorry. You where my whole world for every second you where here.  i hope i see you again dad <3

Listened to this yesterday and I've simply fallen in love with it! One of the best songs I've listened to. Only after watching the end of this video did I learn that it was about death and losses. That doesn't change the song's beauty though. If anything, this song teaches me to love and value those who are important in my life, as losing a loved one is so hurtful. I lost my grand-aunt last year and it was the first time that death hit me in my life. My grand-aunt, whose name was Maltilde, was a person who marked my childhood and impacted it in so many positive ways. I remember when she'd make me food every time I went to her house as a child. It really really hurt. I am very shy and had never said "I love you" to my mom, but after listening to this song, I was so overwhelmed by its message that I decided to overcome my shyness and tell her I love her. She's one of the most important people in my life and I love her from the bottom of my heart. There are tears coming out of my eyes as I write this. Thank you so much, Imagine Dragons, for writing such a beautiful and well thought of song. Enjoy your time with those you love, because you never know when they'll be gone. Also always make sure to value the important things in life. Love from Brazil!

Who is she? What's the story behind this song?

Alisha is his sister-in-law, married to his brother. She was always there for Dan through the Ups and downs. When Dan was first starting out and getting a name for the Band, she was there supporting and promoting. She was his big sister essentially. Trying to describe Alisha and her enrapturing smile and personality, is too long to list, lol, because she honestly was that amazing. Her empathy for people was astonishing. Her soul and life force was everything that you believed to be in humanity. Alisha was my best friend, and it breaks my heart not having her part of this world. I'm so thankful for Dan and imagine dragons making this song. It hurts every time to hear it on the radio, but how amazing it is to know, that this song was made especially about my best friend. Love you and miss you Lish! #fckcancer

I'm a little late when I discovered this but I'm so glad I did.When I heard this song for the first time in the car I literally started to break down and cried in remembrance of my father who left this world to soon back in 2018,him and I had love,a passion for musical masterpieces like this one, he would remember classic songs to share with me and I would showcase new ones to him almost everyday, we worked together so we carpooled a half hour to work and back for almost 10 years each day just listening and enjoying,I kinda lost that love once he was gone because it was just to hard for me to listen to music as I once did but you ,imagine dragons, have brought this love back and reminded me of all the great times I had with my father,I thank you so much for this and I want everyone to know no matter how hard tragic losses can be,try not to lose your passion for what you love ,like I did but now I'm sharing my love for music with my family and showcasing new hits with them, I wanna thank all who take the time to read this and I wish the absolute best for you,God bless ğŸ¥¹ğŸ˜‡ğŸ«¶

(And now) it is two years since Joe's death.  I am stronger, but still fragile - weak.  (Our) dogs, Jaq (Jack) & Brooke have literally, 'held my hand' these two years now since I last spoke with Joe, while he was alive.  The dogs have been my comforters - almost nurses, counselors.  Each time I feed them, put them to bed at night, and play with them throughout the day I remember Joe.  His presence is felt in an extraordinary way.  Silence.  Peace.  Silence.  Music.  Silence.  Dance.  Almost, as if in a trance (at times)...I see and enjoy Joe's presence.  'Joe, I'm not afraid, but it has been difficult.  The garden, where you sat in the mornings, is beautiful. Growing.  A true memorial to you, to life eternal.  It is a testimony to our love together on this earth, and beyond.  May I be but a messenger, a vessel, holding that precious thing called life - (your) blood, sweat, flesh, desire, bliss, ecstasy - Heaven j- Nirvana.

I am 24 years old now and so was He. A friend I had the chance to grow up with since I knew the meaning of the word "friendship" gave in to all the sadness that piled up on him little by little for years and ended his life a week ago from the day I am posting this comment here. He was always full of joy and kept all of us laughing for hours every chance he got. It breaks my heart to know all of us couldn't be there for him when he needed us to be or never let us notice what he went through when he was alone. This song brings in all his memories rushing back and reminds me to tell people how dangerous and devastating bottling up sadness can be to you. Please reach out to close ones before its too late because one different choice you make can destroy all the lives that cared equally for you too. Please find help before you give up on a life that could've been a beautiful one. Love to everyone that's suffering, I hope life will turn around for you. Love to everyone that'll find the tiniest ledge to hang on to, struggling everyday to hold onto their precious life.

Honestly, I never comment on videos, but this is an exception and the situation calls for it, I need to vent. This song has a special meaning for me, it is an emotional song that Imagine Dragon released just when I broke up with my first girlfriend, with whom I had been with for almost 6 years. I was "Wrecked" at the time and this song probably has her name on it. However, today I am not writing for this. Yesterday, while I was preparing to go to the Imagine Dragons concert in Santiago (Spain) and fulfill a dream, my beautiful dog Nala passed away due to a tumor. We adopted her 9 years ago, a dog that had just given birth and that nobody wanted because of her age and because she had leismania. When we saw her, she conquered the hearts of my family and mine. His departure destroys my soul and the only thing that saved me yesterday from the moment was the performance of Imagine Dragons Today IÂ´m "Wrecked", but if Imagine Dragons has taught me anything, it's that "it's okay not to be okay", but that you have to move on, despite everything. This song, as well as my heart, will always be yours Nala. I know that we have given you the best possible life and that you were happy, I am proud of it.

I absolutely love Imagine Dragons, and while I'm usually not a fan of songs with this kind of sound, I can say that these lyrics hit deeper when you have lost a loved one. I lost my father 17 years ago. 2 weeks after my 14th birthday. His death has haunted me for almost 2 decades because I was his babygirl. His last words, 8 months before the wreck, were "I love you, babygirl", to which I replied " I hate you. I hope you fucking die". I was an angry 14 year old kid because my parents had just gotten divorced after 21 years of marriage, and my father was in active addiction at the time, and at the time of his death. But he was my everything. These lyrics definitely made me stop and give this song another chance, and now I'm sitting here in tears while holding the watch that he was wearing when he died. ğŸ˜­

Hey you. Yes, you. You're probably scrolling through the comments, like I am, reading all these motivational comments. If you are reading this at night, you should get some sleep, and don't stress about everything going on in the world, or what you are going through. Don't dwell on things from the past, don't stress on your future. Just live your life, because you only get one. Do whatever makes you happy, not what other people want from you. I lost my great grandfather 5 years ago, he passed away at the age of 103. I heard the message that he had passed away from my parents at the first day of the high  school  midterm. After that moment, after the funeral, afterwards, all along I've been constantly convincing myself that it's natural, "people would eventually pass away", so don't cry, don't be dramatically saying how I miss him or something. But upon hearing this song, it instantly untied the knot. I realized deep down I actually miss him so very much and recall the memory when I heard the message. My first reaction was "It can't be. One more week, no, one more day, after the midterm, I'll go straight to your place to visit you one last time." This song actually helped me face my great grandfather's death in a more healthy way.

Thanks @ Imagine Dragons for sharing your souls ...and recalling the hurt that comes when we've  all lost something, someone near and dear to us....this song always makes me tear up emotionally because it makes think of my sister who was lost far too soon from this earth in her second battle with cancer....(she beat it once-breast cancer-which she fought for years) and it came back 15 years years later....except in her brain....she fought 2 valliant years and remained positive and never complained that her days were limited...(the brain cancer was stage 4 when discovered and terminal)    she  left a daughter and young son who we all helped raise after  her passing...She was bright star and always made us laugh with her humor and spirit...she touched many lives and many who knew her would definitely wish for "one more rainy day to be with her"   I know one day we will see each other and she'll  be there to show me the ropes when its my time...after ive taken my last breath here....Thanks again for the tears this song brings...for I  believe it brings the tears of sorrow out of my soul! Because I can see her dancing to all your songs without one care who was watching...so...i get it! And it leaves me feeling better after the good cry....(fist bumps) may you all heal from your loss...

He will Thomas. Your dad will be there smiling and proud of you for carrying on in spite of his absence. I truly believe the ones we love are such a life force that they never really leave us. I have a few loved ones who have passed and I can feel them when I let myself. I hope this brings you some comfort-- I read it often:  Death is nothing at all. It does not count. I have only slipped away into the next room. Nothing has happened. Everything remains exactly as it was. I am I, and you are you, and the old life that we lived so fondly together is untouched, unchanged. Whatever we were to each other, that we are still. Call me by the old familiar name. Speak of me in the easy way which you always used. Put no difference into your tone. Wear no forced air of solemnity or sorrow. Laugh as we always laughed at the little jokes that we enjoyed together. Play, smile, think of me, pray for me. Let my name be ever the household word that it always was. Let it be spoken without an effort, without the ghost of a shadow upon it. Life means all that it ever meant. It is the same as it ever was. There is absolute and unbroken continuity. What is this death but a negligible accident? Why should I be out of mind because I am out of sight? I am but waiting for you, for an interval, somewhere very near, just round the corner. All is well. Nothing is hurt; nothing is lost. One brief moment and all will be as it was before. How we shall laugh at the trouble of parting when we meet again! ~Henry Scott Holland

I'm 30 and I lost my father in a car crash back in 2005 and it still hunts me not being able to say goodbye and meet him before he went but I wasn't privileged with that opportunity. I was hardly overcoming that then suddenly fell in love with a girl and despite all the odds she also had same feelings although she was 2 years older than me and then from 2009 I was in a relationship with her and I was so happy to be able to marry her on 2019 but just before few months prior to getting married she left me and fell in love with someone else as she told me. With heavy heart had to cancel my marriage but to this day I'm hunted with her memories, all the places we visited together hunts me and I keep praying if all these were just a dream and everything was alright in the real world but it seems the pain doesn't go away. After listening to this song I really feel I'm wrecked mentally without her even though I'm living, I'm dead inside. Depression took better of me and tried to give up but that option didn't seemed fair since I've a mother I can't go away doing something stupid but is living like a dead person worth it?? I ask myself. I felt so lucky when I got to know she had the same feelings for me back then and thought my sad days were over but I was so wrong. Life is just unfair. I'm still overcoming the scars but time doesn't heal anything even though people say, time just adds up more pain each day. Hope I find peace someday.

Thank you for this song.  The parable of the missing teacher.  â€¦. In a world full of thoughts, insight, and opportunity. Comes a world of misdirection, missed opportunity and lost motivation.  This story has one educator and one student. When does a student become something out of nothing?  â€¦ an aging student with a compass that has no barring. This student is in a situation of wonder and loss. Through a journey of no Synchronicity, and no rythmia. Begins to search for lifeâ€™s balance and meaning. Signs begin to appear as this student begins the hard work of opening envelopes. These envelopes (metaphorical) require effort and energy. There can be a sense of flow that happens. But for this student they have no flow. No foundation, only hints of techniques left from past lives.  As this story begins; As student opens envelope after envelope. This student only becomes more and more lost in nature. This student has no choice but to call on help. Help from anyone, anything. Only looking for support and love. This student puts out vast amounts of envelopes. Using up nearly all of the energy this student has been saving. Energy is scarce for this student as much of it has been lost along the wayâ€¦ This through punishment, mocking and bullying from other students. Never to know why! Life has been challenging for this student. Who has seen no real-lesson to be offered. At least to this point.  As this student begins to look at life as too much to comprehend. With, uncountable nights passing byâ€¦. A message is received! Finally, finally a message from another student. Out of the blueâ€¦ But this student is a teacher. One that comes from far away but the connection is bonded by â€œspiritâ€. This, says the teacher. Student thinks â€œSpiritâ€, Iâ€™ve always loved spirit and now spirit has shown compassion towards me.  So student and teacher agree on a hill to meet at a specific day and time. Student canâ€™t wait for this day to come. â€œMaybe I will get someone to help me with this broken compass?â€ He thinks.  As time arrives student and teacher finally meet. This teacher has rumors of being very wise very compassionate very in touch with spirit. And student can see these instantly after their first helloâ€¦ â€¦ Teacher begins with a prayer. With full-wisdom on display. The student thinks to himself. â€œWow, life handed me so many choices and this is what itâ€™s all been forâ€. â€œIve survived, and this is now my turn to live and learn. The student quietly says to himself.â€ Time with these two, has gone by with so many envelopes being opened and answeredâ€¦. Finally life is slowly giving back the energy that has been lost. And student quickly begins to feel what it is to live again.  As their meeting begins to end. Student thanks teacher for their sync. Teacher announces there will be another meeting! And I will bring you more knowledge. Some in literature, some in guidance and experience. As student begins to thank his teacher. He remembers but wait! â€œTeacher, I have no money or possessions to offer for your trip and time?â€  Teacher says, â€œno need for your money. I only ask for your heart and your willingness to learn with me.â€ Their goodbye was cherished. As the student begins to believe in life and humanity again. Student sleeps with a light smile that nightâ€¦. Days pass with no word from his teacher and wonder begins to creep in. This student knows he has the power of resilience on his side but canâ€™t shake the feelings of, â€œDid I mistakingly open up again. And now will I be punished for doing so?â€  Student holds strong for many days. But wonder and disappoint begin to dissolve the energy that was once beginning to replenish for the studentâ€¦.. This student continues to work hard on positive thoughts and intent. But after many attempts to speak with spirit. Spirit is nowhere to be found.  This student begins to become sad again at life. Wondering, as he says to himself. â€œHow can a wise teacher such as him, leave such a unwatered tree as myself?â€ â€œWhat is happening here, what is the lesson?â€ This student begins to believe. There is no lesson. Only the cold hard fact of, life.  Student has a choice to make. Do I keep attempting to persuade spirit to show its self again. Or, do I not? This student attempts to do things that long ago made him content. But canâ€™t find happiness in them anymore. He begins to believe teacher was just a force similar to all of the other challenges heâ€™s faced in life. But this time, has a deep hurt. A hurt that is a little bit heavier than most.  This student never hears back from his teacher and never comes across another like him. As he lives out the rest of his days on earth.  But as time goes by. The student knows that he did nothing wrong and that it was the teacher that will forever have to hold onto the envelope he stopped unfolding. One he could of helped. This teacher knows there was something he could of done more for this student as the student had survived much longer than many before.  Teacher will have to live with the missed opportunity for the rest of his livesâ€¦. â€¦.. You seeâ€¦ this wasnâ€™t a lesson solely belonging to the student. It was a lesson for both! The teacher showed what it is to stop opening the envelope as is had a profound impact on the student.  And the student had many chances, many choices to discover the meanings behind the abandonment he has received so many times before. But because the student believes in his heart and spirit he continued to live out his journey. Never able to fully let go of his losses. This will be with him in his next lives as well.

Dad and I argued here and there. He chose his wife over me, but I knew he still cared. He just didn't want her to take my 2 yr old brother. So I left home, and felt like shit for years, hating myself, hating him, hating his wife. I was 15. Dad had cancer before and beat it. Only for it to come back and take him from me. I was doing great, I was busting my ass to make a name and alife so I can prove my love to my dad, so I could be part of his life again. But in one swift year, I lost him. And the last conversation I had with him on his deathbed telling him stuff I didn't have the balls to tell him before he was dying and coughing up his own lungs. Because the truth was, I pushed the pain of losing him so far down that I never stopped to try and get my father back. December 13th, 2020, 2:37 am I received a call from my older brother, and I couldn't say anything. I was too shocked. Since then I let my depression get the better of me, lost my car, my home, my job, my faith. And I look in the mirror every day now and see his face, I look just like him, and I miss him all over again, and remember what I threw out in a depressed haze of self hate. I miss you dad. Second year without you won't be any easier.

I lost my younger brother 3 months ago unexpectedly. It's so hard to comprehend how someone with that kind of spirit, that kind of personality, that kind of energy would just be gone in a split of a second. You'll never know real grief until it hits you. You'll never know what "rock bottom" means until it hits you. The stuff that you see in movies don't even compare. I look normal on the outside but inside I am dead. The things that brought my brother and I so much joy are now the very same things that torment me everyday.  Whenever I hear this song I just bawl my eyes out, but then I also feel that I am not alone. Grief is a collective, cross cultural feeling, despite "after life" being  a cultural one. This song is so powerful, so raw, so real. Thank you for sharing it to the rest of the world...and... I'll see you again my loved one :-)

"Days pass by and my eyes stay dry, and I think that I'm okay 'Til I find myself in conversation, fading away" Hit me hard, especially when attached to what was happening in the video. I am always lonely even when surrounded by people, and "fading away" I disassociate so I literally fade away mentally. The other lines lost me though, until  the line "I'll see you again, my loved one" that was like an anvil hit my chest followed by 5 gallons of ice water. Might sound stupid to some of you, but, I recently had to give my service dog to a rescue, he was my rock, he helped me get through the day, and be sane, and not in a ball on the floor, or in bed, or non functioning in general... and all that just hit me and the rest of the song kinda clicked to that realization of who this song made me remember and how amazing the time we had was.

May sound corny but it was something I never felt with anyone else. How I miss her randomness and open to whatever because we were together. She did admit to me we should have gotten married. We never crossed that line which made it special to me. I never missed anyone more other than my parents and grandparents. She was and always be my lifetime love.

I cry every time I hear it. It beautifully captures life after the loss of someone you love so deeply. It's been 7 years since I lost my husband. He had just turned 39, and his heart simply stopped beating. No illness, no medical conditions, no drugs, no reason.  My heart hasn't beat properly since that day. I lost my dad 11 months and 1 week later when his heart stopped. 6 months and 3 days after I lost my dad (on my birthday) I had pit tickets to see Imagine Dragons, and got off work early to get ready, when I received the phone call that my best friend was found after committing suicide. I still can't bring myself to go to one of their shows. Maybe next year.

Her name was Carri. Knew her since high school back in 88-92. Had a crush on her back then. Life happened I ended up divorced. Years later in 2013 I messaged Carri now also divorced. We hit it off instantly. Sadly she was an alcoholic. We lasted a year but with so many friends in common and a mutual best friend we couldn't not stay in contact, fight, not talk and then talk more, lol. We tried two other times to make it work but she preferred alcoholic men and the more I got my life on track the less she wanted anything more than friends and mu one stipulation that she get help for the alcoholism was a deal breaker for her.. One year ago today, on September 3rd 2020 she left us. Liver failure from an alcohol addiction she couldn't beat. My whole world collapsed. We all miss her, her laughs, inappropriate sense of humor, kindness, her desire for everyone to be happy. This song speaks to me so much. She like Imagine Dragons. She'd have loved this song too since she lost her son to an asthma attack in 2018.

This song says it all.  Last year my 10 year old twins lost their mother to lung cancer.  Half of their lives she fought for hers.  Chemotherapy, radiation, lobectomy, immunotherapies were just ways to have her with us a little longer.  Watching her die slowly over her last 5 years was the toughest thing I have ever done.  Now at 56 I am raising my twins alone during the worst pandemic humanity has ever seen.  It feels like all the hardships I faced throughout my life have only prepared me for what lies ahead. My girlfriend committed suicide 3 years ago. Her and I were together for almost 7 years. She never once talked to me without telling me that she loved me more than anything. Every time we had an argument, she would hug me until I calmed down. We would go on drives most weekends out to empty spaces, we would park the car and lay on the hood and stare at the stars. Often times we would have long deep conversations for hours until we fell asleep holding each others hands tightly. We both always knew, we would never cheat, never leave. It would never be worth it, and we always saw the amazing person standing in front of us. When I couldn't stand to look at my own reflection, she complimented me on how many people would rather be me, than their own selves. She told me her deepest, darkest secrets, and was never scared to tell the truth, no matter how painful it might've been. We dated from middle school and high school, and even college. We spent years, on the bus, listening to music, looking in each others' eyes. Most days we took the bus home to my house, and spent the whole day playing card games. board games, and watching movies. We were more than lovers, we were best friends, we were family. I met her in a mental hospital after we both had attempted suicide. She has taught me so much. And even though she is not here today, I know that she wants me to stay alive, to keep pushing my limits, regardless of what others think. I wish I could've saved her. Been there for her more. Every time I listen to this song I am reminded of her, and her everlasting kindness, and good heart, no matter what she was feeling. She was truly selfless. So I say to you, scrolling through the comments, STAY SAFE, STAY HEALTHY, AND STAY ALIVE. YOU ARE LOVED

â€‹@Rosie Red  I started to cry, reading Yours and @Meditation Relaxing Music comments.. So many of us go through this.. Been there myself. Only thing what got me through these tough years, was thinking about my mom and my best friend (soul sister) - they would be devastated if I did something to myself... I was in state, where I didn't care about myself, but I love them too much too hurt them like that. So I let myself feel what I felt and talked with myself - like in self therapy. Why are you feeling like that? Is it so bad or you made it so big thinking about it over and over again... And step by step I got to bottom of my problems. And when I got better, even my ex husband (alcoholic) called me and wanted to meet me to apologize for what he did wrong in our marriage. I was shocked. He always blamed me in every argument. We met and I forgave him. You can not  always meet those people, who hurt You before, but you can put them in a boat in Your mind, and let them swim off and say goodbye... there are so many ways we can do step by step... Please never give up. Remember that - even if You think You are alone, there are so many people struggling with their demons. Try to talk in Youtube comments with others like You. It really helps.  Write to me if You want. This world is crazy, but every one of us deserves happiness. Stay alive, be good to Yourself!

Cant have been that selfless if she killed herself, leaving you behind. I know people are thinking that this is a totally rude and disrespectful comment, but its staying as a reminder to everyone that when they take their own lives, the leave everyone behind, the bad and the good.

@@bobfred4410 You are not rude. It is just - we don't know her and how bad she felt if she made that step. Good or nothing about people who are not between us anymore. :) I feel You. We imagine what would happen if close to us person did that. It hurts as hell. When I said to my mother that I had these bad thoughts and love for her got me through this, she said - please, don't even think about doing it to yourself. - And she is right. @@cosmicgentdareal7435 oh no, that's awful, man. I have been in Your grilfriends  skin. I thought about it when I was in a relationship. What is a reason if it is not too personal to ask? Bad thoughts about herself or some traumatic experience? Mine was low self asteem and husband alcoholic, so I got kind of co-dependent. Sleepless nights, when Im stressed- I dont eat, so low in vitamins, minerals etc. I didnt got any help. No one believed he is an alcoholic, because he is an narcistic and knows how to get liked and everyone drinks You know they said. I felt alone af. Just my best friend soul sister said - I dont understand, because I dont see these worse situations you told me happend, but, Im there for You. I got angry when other friend said - go to therapy, it helped me. I wasnt ready for that. I got in self therapy and asked my self many questions. As example - why you want to save him? He doesnt want that. He is grown ass man and let him do whatever he wants. Just get out of that bad relationship, even if you still love him. You cant make family with him. You deserve better. Even if you dont think now. It always gets better when you stop thinking about it and start doing, like 20min sport seasons. Regularily. Every week. I did just 2x a week. Just do things step by step. I didnt move out right away. I wasnt ready psihologicaly. I was in to low self asteem position.

Imagine Dragons have always been a cutting edge alternative rock-pop group. But this song represents a quantum leap into a stratospheric darkness and mystery reminiscent of the great post-punk bands of the Eighties. Up there with the Bunnymen's "In Bluer Skies, Flaming Red or "In the Margins", Joy Division's "In a Lonely Place" or "Decades" in terms of depth and poignancy, this song is going to be more iconic than "Bohemian Rhapsody."  As far as I was concerned music in the 2020's was dead, I knew Imagine Dragons were a great band but had no idea they would be the saviour of modern music! "Wrecked" even has the edge on Linkin Park's "Numb" in my opinion! Possibly the saddest and most beautiful song ever written?

â€œShe was the brightest light. A beacon of joy and strength for everyone she met. Her sudden passing has shaken me in ways that I still am unable to express,â€ Reynolds had said in a statement. â€œI was with her and my brother when she passed, and it was the first time in my life that I had witnessed death in this way. It sealed into my mind the fragility of life and finality of this all. Iâ€™ve watched my brother face something that no one should have to. But Iâ€™ve also seen his faith bring him hope in a future with her. I can only hope for the same.â€ Reynolds continued. â€œThis song was my way of dealing with it all, as music has always been my refuge. No longer being a man of fervent faith, I can only hope that she hears it somewhere in a place where she is healed and no longer in pain. (This is) a recital of the Mercy of thy Lord to His servant Zakariya. 3. Behold! he cried to his Lord in secret, 4. Praying: "O my Lord! infirm indeed are my bones, and the hair of my head doth glisten with grey: but never am I unblest, O my Lord, in my prayer to Thee! 5. "Now I fear (what) my relatives (and colleagues) (will do) after me: but my wife is barren: so give me an heir as from Thyself,- 6. "(One that) will (truly) represent me, and represent the posterity of Jacob; and make him, O my Lord! one with whom Thou art well-pleased!" 7. (His prayer was answered): "O Zakariya! We give thee good news of a son: His name shall be Yahya: on none by that name have We conferred distinction before." 8. He said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son, when my wife is barren and I have grown quite decrepit from old age?" 9. He said: "So (it will be) thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: I did indeed create thee before, when thou hadst been nothing!'" 10. (Zakariya) said: "O my Lord! give me a Sign." "Thy Sign," was the answer, "Shall be that thou shalt speak to no man for three nights, although thou art not dumb." 11. So Zakariya came out to his people from him chamber: He told them by signs to celebrate Allah's praises in the morning and in the evening. 12. (To his son came the command): "O Yahya! take hold of the Book with might": and We gave him Wisdom even as a youth, 13. And piety (for all creatures) as from Us, and purity: He was devout, 14. And kind to his parents, and he was not overbearing or rebellious. 15. So Peace on him the day he was born, the day that he dies, and the day that he will be raised up to life (again)! 16. Relate in the Book (the story of) Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place in the East. 17. She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them; then We sent her our angel, and he appeared before her as a man in all respects. 18. She said: "I seek refuge from thee to (Allah) Most Gracious: (come not near) if thou dost fear Allah." 19. He said: "Nay, I am only a messenger from thy Lord, (to announce) to thee the gift of a holy son. 20. She said: "How shall I have a son, seeing that no man has touched me, and I am not unchaste?" 21. He said: "So (it will be): Thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: and (We wish) to appoint him as a Sign unto men and a Mercy from Us': It is a matter (so) decreed." 22. So she conceived him, and she retired with him to a remote place. 23. And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree: She cried (in her anguish): "Ah! would that I had died before this! would that I had been a thing forgotten and out of sight!" 24. But (a voice) cried to her from beneath the (palm-tree): "Grieve not! for thy Lord hath provided a rivulet beneath thee; 25. "And shake towards thyself the trunk of the palm-tree: It will let fall fresh ripe dates upon thee. 26. "So eat and drink and cool (thine) eye. And if thou dost see any man, say, 'I have vowed a fast to (Allah) Most Gracious, and this day will I enter into not talk with any human being'" 27. At length she brought the (babe) to her people, carrying him (in her arms). They said: "O Mary! truly an amazing thing hast thou brought! 28. "O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a man of evil, nor thy mother a woman unchaste!" 29. But she pointed to the babe. They said: "How can we talk to one who is a child in the cradle?" 30. I've lost one of my best friends, my mother, both grandparents, and my wife in my lifetime. It's funny how losing a family member or a best friend can leave you in a state of mourning. But nothing can compare to losing the one you love. It does things to you. Destroys you from within. Can even blur the lines of reality. And in some cases lead one to suicide. A lot of people have no clue how much more it hurts to lose the love of your life, than it does to lose your friends or family.

I always listen to birds, burn out and shots (one of his favorites) and since he's been gone (I said been because I truly believe one day I would see him again) some bands that him and I used to listen are my anchor to get to survive. We both struggled with mental health and, by the time that he was living he couldn't make it. A part of me is missing since he left, but I could hold on for him with the help of songs that could remind me of him. And this song in specifically made me feel closer to him once more. Thank you

This song hit me so hard when I heard it for the first time today. My mom passed away about 4 months ago. We were very close and I'm only 21;I was still living at home with her. I know this was written about a specific person, but it's almost like Dan wrote it for me. I know the feelings exactly the way he describes. Know one knows or understands the constant onslaught of random pain and depression until they actually go through it. The only way I've been able to get through this is knowing that she placed her faith in Jesus Christ and one day I'll see her again. I'll tell you though, knowing that doesn't make it hurt any less. As much as it hurts to listen to the song, I'm glad I've heard it.

Steven I doubt there are very many people who haven't been utterly 'wrecked' by the loss of someone they deeply loved. You said it best with: " Know (no ) one knows or understands the constant onslaught of random pain and depression until they actually go through it. " As long as we associate with others through blood, marriage, friendship  or affection we are going to experience the kind of loss you describe and are going through right now. My deep condolences on the loss of your beloved mother- mine passed in 2008 and there are still times when I would give anything to have just one more conversation with her.

@@jaycorby You're absolutely right, Jay. The only reason I am going through this pain is because of the depth of the love I had for her. I'm so thankful for the full and meaningful life she lived that I got to share in. And thanks Jay for taking the time to respond to me. It means a lot to know that people out there do care.

As a recently divorced man, I will say I am glad I no longer feel this way about the separation. To any of you going through a separation - I will say it was the hardest time of my life. Do yourself a favor, and throw out every reminder. Delete ALL the pictures, saved playlists, text and message threads, unfollow them. Do this sooner rather than later, I wish I had. It will be tough but in the long run it will get easier and doing that will help. And try not to linger on thoughts of reuniting. Know that other people can and will come into your life, usually when you least expect it. Stay strong.

Dan, I'm so sorry for you and your brother's loss!  She sounds like a true blessing, an Angel on earth, and an amazing friend.  Your heavy heart can be heard throughout the ballad and the effects of the lyrics are felt by many.  The loss of a loved one leaves a hole in your heart and soul that seems to remain empty for a lifetime, as no one is ever capable of replacing that person.  Others will come and go through our lives, some will be special.  For now, hold onto the ones you love for a few seconds longer, and just a bit tighter.  Breathe them in.  Remember their worth in your life.  Don't pack away all the memories for fear of the pain they may bring.  Celebrate the memories with a smile.  Don't let them fade quickly.

Evangelism:  Hell and Heaven you carefully read verses 41 to 48 of chapter 9 of the Gospel of Mark, you noticed a repetition of the consequences for the misuse of our bodies, which includes doing wrong things, walking in the wrong ways and looking at the things they do stumble.  What consequences?  "To go to hell, where the fire never goes out, where your worm doesn't die."  If the Holy Spirit inspired Mark to repeat it so many times, it is because he is talking about something very important: the horrible eternal damnation that does not annihilate man, soul and sensations.      The word â€œhellâ€ does not exist in the originals and was used by translators in place of the term Gehenna and here means eternal torment.  In Matthew 25:41 Jesus speaks of â€œeternal fire prepared for the devil and his angelsâ€, which shows that it is not a condemnation made for human beings, but for spiritual beings.  Men thrown there because they reject the salvation that God offers freely.  This â€œlake of fireâ€ is now empty and will be inaugurated when it receives the beast and the antichrist, then the devil, and finally all the lost, already with their bodies.  (Rev 19:20; 20:10, 15).  At this time the dead are, in spirit, in the condition of Hades, the state of separation between spirit and soul and body, the unbelievers in suffering and pain, and the saved enjoying joy in the presence of the Lord.      If the â€œfireâ€ was â€œprepared for the devil and his angelsâ€, we can be sure that it is not the same type of fire produced with wood, gas or an atomic explosion.  Satan and his angels are spirit and incorporeal beings unless they take human form to deceive.  But an angel could go through an atomic explosion without getting singed.  So it is evident that the Holy Spirit uses realities of the material world to understand spiritual realities.  Fire in the Bible is synonymous with judges and suffering.      By deviating from the popular spread, the lake of fire is not where the lost will live in the company of others.  It's absolute solitude.  Nor is it a place where Satan is the chief tormentor of the lost.  The devil is also one of the condemned inmates there, not someone with privileges.  The fire in this place is not the kind that generates light, as other passages speak to us of â€œouter darkness,â€ which may not only be moral but also literal.  In contrast to this, if you believe in Jesus as your Savior you can give â€œthanks to the Father, that we have become worthy to partake of the saints' origin in the realm of lightâ€¦and blessed us with all spiritual blessings in the heavenly places in Christ â€(Luke 1:12; Eph 1:6).

Some songs just really hit you hard. We all lose people that we love...relatives, friends, idols, etc. Some of them leave in tragic or unexpected ways. Some of them we lose to death, and some we lose to other things. I have had plenty of difficult loss in the last several months that has been excruciating to deal with. However, there is this one that is different from all the others. This one, I lost to bewildering circumstances that would take an hour to explain. It has been 2 years, and I still can't wrap my head around it. All this time has passed, and she still dominates my thoughts all day long. I can't let go. I don't know how. Many say, "get over it!" But, they are not living in my world, and they don't understand the damage. At least, with death, there is some sort of finality to it. It's easier because there is closure. We can go through the stages of grief. We can blame God, or the universe, or the drunk driver, or the overdose, or the person who pulled the trigger. But, what if you can't blame those things? What if there is no closure? How do you let go??? Wow, I didn't expect this to be so long when I started writing it. Hopefully, it will be somehow therapeutic for me. Thank you to anyone who actually reads this all the way to the end.

*{SORRY FOR MISTAKES. I SPEAK ENGLISH BADLY SO I USED GOOGLE TRANSLATOR}* Hello everyone, I'm from Russia and I want to tell you how much I was inspired by Imagine Dragons!  To begin with, I want to say that I was born in a city with a population of less than 300k people. My father left the family when I became 5 or 6. This is normal for 70% of CIS families.  So, I started my acquaintance with this group 4 years ago. It was the end of the 8th grade of my school. (In Russia, 5-9 grades are secondary school, 10-11 are high school).  I studied mediocre. Somewhere I missed school and had no idea why I was studying and who I would become in the future. But one day I came across this wonderful group that changed my life.For a month I listened to their songs, albums and so on. Then I decided to read the translations of the songs and I really liked the songs from the "Night vision" album "It's time". And very encouraging lines /It's time to begin, isn't it?/ And when I read this line in translation and listened to the song again, I understood. You need to change something in your life, set a goal and achieve it at all costs. The next year was the year before the Basic State Exam. This is an exam after which you can enter a technical school. This is one level below the institute. Secondary education. I went to preparation courses and passed the exams well. All this time I spent with my any group imagine dragons. Almost every day I was inspired by their songs and walked towards my goal. I entered the 10th grade and decided to study closely, because I need knowledge to enter a budgetary place at the institute. (You can get to the institute either after technical school or after grade 11 and pass the exam, a very difficult and terrible exam). I chose the second option.  And finally, I passed the exam. I entered the institute on a budget and have already completed my studies for a whole year, passed 2 sessions well and switched to the 2 course without debts! This was my first and important goal. Because my mother works in such a job where it would be impossible to combine the word life and paid education. It would be survival.  And when the group took a break, I understood everything perfectly, Dan wanted to be with his family, I read a lot about his biography, about the biography of the rest of the guys. I understood everything. But hell, how hard it was for me without their new songs, you can't even imagine. And now the day has come when the new album is announced. I was the happiest person on the planet.  By the way, now my goal is to become a director. Make beautiful films and do it with high quality. I hope I can do it. I'm going to buy myself a camera and will try, try and try a lot this autumn! Summing up, I would like to say. I wish every person to find an object that can motivate and support you as much as imagine dragons! Never give up if you are truly burning with your dream. FROM RUSSIA WITH HUUUUUUGE LOVE!!!!!!!!
That is awesome!!! :)

Hey people of youtube i kinda need help from you guys i am having a hard time i know its hard for everyone and its not easy for anyone but i feel like im stuck in a place. I dont know what i expect from this i dont know what will happen but i need to let someone hear it. I am too young to be living in nostalgia and too young to be wishing that i die. The thing is all my life ive been loved half assed when i gave my all. Ive watched people giving up on me for quite long now. It has been one too many time. I was kept as an option for twice where i let my love consume me and eat me from inside. I even killed the little bit of my self respect by begging people to stay. Ive been abused by my ex and after that i got played by another girl after being broken and used by girls one after another. There was this person i met. And since the day one it felt right it felt good with her for the first time somebody valued me and i was myself with her 100% and honest i made so much efforts even the slightest thing she needed i was there for her. She accepted me for who i was and so did I. I never judged her for her past and accepted her for who she really was. She made me believe that this was it she was the person. She was so shocked to know that how people in my past have hurted me and how she would never do that to me. It felt so good when she said she loved me more than anything and that how she was willing to fight for me and could see her spending her life with me. It was all great between us. But then the worse started to kick in she started distancing herself from me and said she needed some space which i was fine with because i understood the need of personal space but she used to ghost me for the time being and then she came how she is confused with her feelings and wasnt sure and yet the next day she used to say she loves me this was so tiresome for me to be fighting and figuring out what i did wrong to not make her love me the day she felt confused after three months of being in this before this we were friends for more than an year and it was great. I watched her slowly give up on me and after promising a future with me and assuring me of everything right. She decided to leave me and said that she was unsure about her feelings and now she grew out of love with me. In just few weeks of her going back home and the last words of her in person were that how i was the best thing ever happened to her. And after giving up on me and leaving me stranded for months not even bothered where i was how i was she came back to the city and asked me to sort things out but only as a friend and that she values our friendship and dont want anything other than that. But then she told me how in those couple of months she developed feelings for this other guy from her class and shes willing to try and work out everything with him which she wasnt sure with me and couldnt see with me even though her words herself said that she did saw a future with me. Now she has apologised for everything for what she has done and that she cant undo all that but she wants to keep our friendship as it was. I too want to have her in my life as she was the best thing ever happened to me but im tired of pretending to be okay with all this when im not. I am hurt and in pain i cry myself to sleep every night i wanted this to work and did everything right for this to happen only to be given up on once again. How am i supposed to be okay with seeing her fall in love with someone else when it should have been me because she promised. Its affecting me i have trouble sleeping in night im growing silent and distant from people my family yells at me for always being in my own room. I cant explain this to them how it takes so much energy for me to just wake up and exist im not enjoying anything im fucked up now.  I dont understand what to do she is willing to work for our friendship and constantly apologise for what has happened and even wants me to go to therapy with her.  I dont understand im tired of fighting again and again and at this point im too scared to live and too scared to die and i just wish i dont wake up one day and it will be fine because it gets so heavy at times. I dont know what to do. Imagine dragons songs have always kept me going and the reason i decided to rant it all over here.

@@bezimienny1337 You've made me scroll through these comments because I saw the words you left this child that's suffering.. I know when people are cruel, usually they need love the most.. so I saw you're 16 and 5 years ago you experienced one of the most traumatic events and loss at around 11 years old & I'm Soo sorry for your loss. It probably feels like yesterday for you & you've been left to make sense of this on your own and that's wrong, although not intentional, everyone processes things differently and I couldn't imagine anyone experiencing this tragedy not being affected by it, with a clear mind to provide someone else's needs & wants, especially a child's but even more than that, you're his son, the one that found him and all hell probably broke loose from that moment on..  It's so hard to imagine things being different than what you imagine when you only have your opinion to go by, which are built by the experiences which give them.. First, know, your dad didn't mean to hurt you by his actions. There's so many conditions that cause underlying depression, suicidal thoughts and it can be so overwhelming & to try to make sense of it when it's unknown, we can only assume and that's dangerous.. people assume they're too much for others, assume the world would be better off without them, assume nobody would listen or care.. I think you get the idea of what I'm saying. But really, they just want the pain to stop and such heavy thoughts weigh down the positive ideas that normally rise and they can't think outside the box.. I've learned that many, if not all people who attempt suicide & live, say they regretted it once they realized what they'd done and many pray for forgiveness, a second chance & come back to live to teach us this. Try to forgive your dad and others who hurt you because they were in pain like I will & hopefully these people affected by your comments, will forgive you because you're in pain.. Also, you are giving your opinion and not stating facts when you speak for others. Please don't believe or tell everyone else there's no higher power when you don't understand it yet.. it's hard to understand how any good can come from something so bad but there's so many dimensions of our existence we cannot see just yet but instead of turning your anger onto other people or yourself, (which I'm proud of you for not turning inwards & acknowledging you need help,) Consider treating others the way you needed when you needed them the most. You'd be surprised how much you can heal just by being that higher power..  The past cannot be changed but only the present and future.  Its easy to be unkind to others, especially when that's all that's given.. But it takes strength and alot of experience to master being kind when it isn't expected or deserved.. but it'll give you that higher power you and the rest of the world needs & you can rise, have greater meaning for life, given more opportunities, change the world and spend your time helping others, you'll look back on this 10 years from now & see things differently, with a new set of eyes.. some middle-aged and older people never have or take the opportunity to learn this and live their whole lives with no purpose. Just grown up bully's, gossip, complain, mean to others & "kick the dog syndrome" ripples down the line of each family creating more conflict and pain & tragedy like you unfortunately experienced & I'm so sorry.. â™¥ï¸

I lost my big brother to complications related to COVID last year in April, just a week before his 38th birthday. My family and I have gotten better with the time that's passed, but some days I just remember he's gone and it's like I lost him all over again. We didn't have the strongest relationship, and as many have said before, I wish I had told him how much I loved him. I wish we didn't fight as much. I feel like I could've been nicer. This is such a beautiful song that almost perfectly captures the grief and pain that I have felt in losing him. To all those who have lost someone, stay strong. Grief hurts like hell, but each day is a little better.

this song made me think and I realised that life has no meaning for me anymore. the story is I've been studying abroad for 17 years. I've never been a happy person but I was fine with it, didn't see it as a problem. Until lately I risked it all and traveled back home during the pandemic which may lead to more problems because I wouldn't be able to return and finish my study. Anyways, when I finally arrived home, I did it mainly for my family, but you know... when you've been gone for over 17 years family considers you to be a stranger and you're no longer treated as family. And that "wrecked" me
Some cultures don't allow us to do any of thatğŸ˜Š Is it my fault cuz I was born here?

@@mizu3711 Don't allow you do what? Call someone? Or love? Or not put off until tomorrow? You didnâ€™t specify, so itâ€™s not very clear. If cultures don't allow it, but you want to do it, maybe it's worth doing it ?? Or is it prosecuted? What could be behind this? In every culture, country there are and were rebels who do not agree with this and they did and do it in their own way. And about the fact that it is your fault, that you were born here, well, of course, that it is not your fault! You know what they say: "We don't choose our parents and our homeland"..

@@kassemister9107 Yeah, it's very sad.. 17 years as if "torn out" of life with family and as if already as "strangers" to each other. Didnâ€™t experience different situations together, didnâ€™t discuss, don't know each other's interests, hobbies, nothing, as if there are no points of contact. It happens that other people, not relatives, who are nearby, know more about you than the family, because they are near, close in spirit. Just, you don't communicate at all in 17 years?? Your family didn't want you to leave and you left and they kind of got offended?? No? But in any case, if you're back and they show you that no matter how "happy" you're back, that's also kind of wrong.

@@Radmila798 yeah you're absolutely right. And about your last question... they know I didn't have a choice but to study abroad and no, they didn't get offended. I just remember when I was a kid, we were much closer and they were alot more caring but now I just feel like a stranger around them and they kinda treat me that way. I don't want them to treat me good or like a king I just want to feel like I am home when being around them, but home doesn't feel like home anymore. That's where you got it right, 17 years with minimum contact is enough time to make you a stranger.

@@kassemister9107 Yeah, really.. It's a psychologically difficult situation when you don't feel comfortable, calm, homely at home as in childhood.. After all, the house of childhood is such a place of tranquility, joy, protection, love, care, serenity. How I would be pleased that your situation changed for the better, so that the ice melted. Just please don't say that life no longer has meaning! It has some more, for example, it makes sense how to correct this situation.. Can you talk to your family? Say all that you feel? See what the rection will be, the answers

For folks who don't have a mind that constantly churns, doesn't stop even when you do everything you can to make it stop, but it won't.....this is an example of what is like with anxiety that literally sits on you. Everyone who has lost someone has that happen for a brief time, and with the passage of time things are easier to accept and you move on. However, for some people, everyday situations can trigger a memory or a thought that will not stop. It is constantly churning till something else takes over. For me, it is depression and anxiety that works like a pendulum with OCD tendencies, and it does not stop. Something embarassing from high school that happened 26 year ago pops up out of nowhere and controls you. No set time limit on it either. Only when another trigger pops up does that thought stop, but it still lingers and will pop up again. Finally sought help and I am better, but this is a perfect example of what it is like. No comparison on the level of pain in the story being told on the singer's sister-in-law, but the similarities of not being able to escape and wanting to run is the same. (I have lost friends in high school to car crashes, I have lost friends to cancer, I lost my dad to lung cancer [insert mad amounts of anger on this one], but the thought of losing my wife presents insurmountable pain, and I send all my healing vibes towards this stranger). Please take care of yourself.

This is not a rock band. It is okay mostly, but a little sad to see what once seemed to be the heirs of Rock now make EDM music. Anyway, we got Maneskin for it.

> This is not a rock band. Well they are a pop leaning pop-rock band > A little sad to see what once seemed to be heirs of rock now make EDM Are you confusing electropop with EDM? Because they have only 2 EDM songs in their 120+ song discography, both of which are not even their full songs, just collabs. They have done electropop since their debut. Since their early independent days, Imagine Dragons have always stayed and switched mostly between rock leaning pop rock and pop leaning pop rock. People like you who are not as familiar with their whole discography often make false assumptions that they got progressively poppier.  They started out as an almost country-pop band, then switched to rock in their 2009 EP, then switched to more synth driven poppy rock for the next two EPs and Night Visions, then got more rock again with their second album Smoke+Mirrors, then got more pop again with their next two albums Evolve and Origins, and this next album they are rumoured to go more rock again. Maneskin are decent. But they are not trailbrazers of rock music either. They are rehashing the same old rock sounds, instead of progressing and helping evolution of the rock genre.
